author: Staff Reporter
text:
Five more accused in the double murder, which occurred in a farm owned by Subash Pannaiyar, president of All India Nadar Padhukappu Peravai, near Pazhayakayal on March 8, were arrested by Authoor police, and produced before Sathankulam Judicial Magistrate Court on Saturday night.

Subash Pannaiyar was the target of the assailants – the supporters of Pasupathi Pandian, the slain leader of Devendra Kula Velalar Kootamaippu.

While Subash Pannaiyar escaped the attempt on his life, his aides M. Arumugasamy (32) of Surandai and A. Kannan (52), a barber in Pazhayakayal, were murdered.

According to Superintendent of Police Ashwin M. Kotnis, the arrested were M. Raja alias Pettai Raja alias Arumugaraja (29) of Pirancheri village near Gangaikondan in Tirunelveli district, V. Durai alias Ilanji Durai (35) of Ilanji, E. Kathiresan (21) and S. Balamurugan (21), both from Pottalkadu in Thoothukudi, and R. Chinnathambi alias Esakkiraja (25) of Arumuganeri in Thoothukudi district.

Already, 11 persons had surrendered in various courts in connection with the case. Some other accomplices would be arrested soon, the SP said.
title: Five accused in double murder case arrested
